fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Single market, Research and innovation
eu_initiatives:
via EuroWindoor AISBL: 
Construction Product Regulation (CPR) 2011/305/EU 
Energy Performance of Buildings Directive (EPBD) 2010/31/EU 
Eco Design Directive 2009/125/EU 
Energy Labelling Framework Directive 2010/30/EU 
Chemical substances (REACH) 2006/1907/EC 
Restriction of Hazardous Substances in electrical and electronic equipment (RoHS) 2011/65/EU 
CEN and ISO-Standardisation
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
goals__remit:
EPW has been established to safeguard the common interests of the European industry and manufacturers of plastic windows  
 
EPW is a non-profit association and was created in January 1999  
EPW shall promote plastic windows and safeguard the supranational interests of members as appropriate, in particular by  
- exchanging information and experiences on issues that are important to the sector  
- conducting joint technical, educational and economic activities in order to ensure a level of playing field for competition  
- cooperating with other association with similar aims  
 
Members of EPW are the representative national associations of European countries
relevant_communication: EPW members agreed in a meeting for preparation of a new AISBL founding on March 25th, 2015 to suspend the operations of EPW and to participate instead to the new European Association EuroWindoor AISBL.
